item.title: booxi was at the ESI in Montreal !
item.dc:creator: Astrid Bertout
item.description: On October 16th and 17th, booxi was at the ESI in Montreal and our CEO M. Daniel Laplante was on of the speakers. Overview of this presentation full of business tips.
item.content:encoded:
October 16th and 17th, booxi was at the Esthetique Spa International and Daniel Laplante, our CEO, was one of the speakers.

The conference “How to Get More Revenues With Less Efforts : using simple and affordable online tools” was a success with a room that was full. M. Laplante was talking about the market statistics, trends, tools, and simple methods to get more results with less efforts. A set of tips easy to apply and providing amazing results.


Your customers are online, you have to be there too. Which is why the conference was talking about tools adapted, affordable and easy to use.

We were there at our booth to answer questions about our smart appointment booking solution. It was also a privilege to receive some of our users, who wanted to share their experience with us, and to learn that they cannot imagine a life without booxi anymore.

A Revenue Increase of Over $6000

For example, one of our customers saw her revenues increase by over $6000 in the last year, by avoiding no-shows (which she estimated to be 3 per week). 3 appointments * $40 = $120 *50 weeks = $6000. With a cost of $400, her return on investment for using booxi has been largely proven.

A Competitive Advantage, That Also Saves a Lot of Time

Another customer explained to us that since she started offering online appointment booking, many customers from her competition became her customers because they like online appointment booking and SMS reminders. A crucial competitive advantage, that in addition of saving you time, will also attract new customers.

Don’t waste time anymore, enjoy the benefits provided by booxi and easily increase your revenues

item.title: booxi is proud to have contributed to the success of the Hair Fashion Night of L’Oréal Professionnel event.
item.dc:creator: Astrid Bertout
item.description: Thanks to its easy-friendly use and its features, booxi contributed to the success of an event organized by L'Oréal Professionnel, that required a smart solution to manage appointments.
item.content:encoded:
On May 12th 2016, booxi participated to the successful Hair Fashion Night in Toronto event organized by L’Oréal Professionnel. With a progressive opening of places and with more than 700 appointments made in only 4 days, the event was rapidly sold out.

In order to support this complex logistic of automatically assigning attendees to one of the 50 stylists, according to the available time slots per stylist, L’Oréal Professionnel has chosen booxi.

Attendees were able to reserve online from the L’Oréal Professionnel booxi page, Facebook and a custom mobile app, then receive a confirmation by email with their designated time and stylist. A major time savings for the organizers, and a great experience for the participants.

 

Appointment online booking was suspended because all time slots were filled, and resumed 3 days later, following the opening of 150 new spaces by L’Oréal Professionnel.

The event was a success and booxi is happy to have helped a company as large as L’Oréal Professionnel, as it daily supports SMEs and self-employed workers.

About L’Oréal

L’Oréal has devoted itself to beauty for over 105 years. With its unique international portfolio of 32 diverse and complementary brands, the Group generated sales amounting to 22.5 billion euros in 2014 and employs 78,600 people worldwide. As the world’s leading Beauty Company, L’Oréal is present across all distribution networks: mass market, department stores, pharmacies and drugstores, hair salons, travel retail and branded retail.

Research and innovation, and a dedicated research team of 3,700 people, are at the core of L’Oréal’s strategy, working to meet beauty aspirations all over the world and attract one billion new consumers in the years to come. L’Oréal’s new sustainability commitment for 2020 “Sharing Beauty With All”sets out ambitious sustainable development objectives across the Group’s value chain.
